Class Alert

java.lang.Object
Alert
public class Alert extends Object
Represents an alert for abnormal usage patterns (e.g., high consumption, leak).

Behavior: Each instance is assigned a monotonically increasing alertID using a class-level counter. The alert's date is captured at construction time using LocalDate.now() in the system default time zone.

Thread-safety: ID assignment via the static nextAlertID counter is not synchronized. If instances are created concurrently across threads, consider adding external synchronization or migrating to an atomic counter to avoid ID collisions.

I/O: The trigger() method prints a human-readable representation of the alert to standard output. For GUI or logging frameworks, prefer getAlertDetails().

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Alert

      public Alert(String meterID, String alertType, String alertMessage)
      Creates a new alert with an auto-assigned ID and today's date.
      Parameters:
      meterID - the meter ID that triggered the alert (e.g., device/installation ID)
      alertType - the type/category of alert (e.g., HIGH_USAGE, LEAK)
      alertMessage - a detailed, human-readable description of the condition

  • Method Details

    • trigger

      public void trigger()
      Emits the alert to standard output in a multi-line format suitable for consoles.

      Intended for simple demos or CLI tools. Applications with UI frameworks or logging requirements should consider consuming getAlertDetails() instead.

    • getAlertDetails

      public String getAlertDetails()
      Returns a single-line, formatted description of this alert.
      Returns:
      a string in the form Alert[<id>]: <type> - <message> (<meterId>) on <date>

    • getAlertID

      public int getAlertID()
      Gets the unique identifier assigned to this alert.
      Returns:
      the alert ID

    • getMeterID

      public String getMeterID()
      Gets the ID of the meter that triggered the alert.
      Returns:
      the meter ID (may be null if not provided)

    • getAlertType

      public String getAlertType()
      Gets the alert type/category.
      Returns:
      the alert type string (e.g., HIGH_USAGE, LEAK)

    • getAlertMessage

      public String getAlertMessage()
      Gets the detailed message explaining the alert.
      Returns:
      the alert message

    • getAlertDate

      public LocalDate getAlertDate()
      Gets the date on which the alert was created.
      Returns:
      the alert date (local system date)
